detail:
Chivito is the national dish of Uruguay. It is a thin slice of tender cooked beefsteak, with mozzarella, ham, tomatoes, mayonnaise and black or green olives, and commonly also bacon and fried or hard-boiled eggs, served as a sandwich in a bun, often accompanied by French-fried potatoes. 
Main ingredients: Bun, churrasco beef, bacon, fried or hard-boiled eggs, ham, black or green olives, mozzarella, tomatoes, mayonnaise.

Borek or burek is a filled Anatolian, Balkan, Cypriot, Middle Eastern and Central Asian pie made of a thin flaky dough such as filo with a variety of fillings, such as meat, cheese, spinach or potatoes. 
Main ingredients: Flaky pastry (usually filo), various fillings.

This Mushroom & Buckwheat Soup is a gluten-free version of mushroom barley soup. It's full of flavor, texture and will surely become a favorite! 
Main ingredients: Mushrooms, leeks, buckwheat groats.

Roti john is an omelette sandwich first believed to be made in Singapore during the 1960s or 1970s. It later became widely popular, spreading throughout the Malay Peninsula in present-day Malaysia and in modern-day Indonesia as street food. 
Main ingredients: Minced meat, onion, egg, tomato-chilli sauce and a baguette-type loaf.

A pancake is a flat cake, often thin and round, prepared from a starch-based batter that may contain eggs, milk and butter and cooked on a hot surface such as a griddle or frying pan, often frying with oil or butter. It is a type of batter bread.
A wonton is a type of Chinese dumpling commonly found across regional styles of Chinese cuisine. It is also spelled wantan or wuntun in transliteration from Cantonese and wenden from Shanghainese.

Meatloaf is a dish of ground meat that has been combined with other ingredients and formed into the shape of a loaf, then baked or smoked. The final shape is either hand-formed on a baking tray, or pan-formed by cooking it in a loaf pan.
